comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29707/supplements/8013/pa... London Gazette 14 August, 1916 has him promoted to Lieutenant. www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=29836263 ? might be him. [a bit later] www.universitystory.gla.ac.uk/ww1-biography/?id=4179 the University of Glasgow even has a brief bio! [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] I'm sure they'd love to know about this pic... Another web hit suggests he played the [parental guidance recommended] bagpipes! Maybe need to check whether there were any other chaps in the Scottish Rifles named Graham Nelson before assuming this is him...but I'd say there's a very good chance it is. One of countless sad, sad WW1 stories.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Ah, and here is the link to his grave plot at Cathcart on CWGC, thanks Quasymody! I am wondering how it came to be in a collection relating to Captain Robert McKilliam (1861-1934), who worked for a time for the Aberdeen White Star Line. A Scottish family connection in there somewhere! I have sent the image to the University of Glasgow, perhaps they will be able to enlighten us some more :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
